news_items.content: Here is a rewritten version of the provided news article:
Tamil Nadu: 14 fishermen arrested by Sri Lankan Navy for crossing International Maritime Boundary Line. The fishing community seeks support from the central government.
Two persons held in hit and run incident turns out to be murder in Thirumangalam. Residents urge authorities to upgrade aging water pipelines alongside circular routes.
Chennai News:
* 15 Tamil Nadu fishermen return from Iran, efforts are made to rescue others.
* Chennai College students drown in Coimbatore River.
* Woman attacked by robbers dies in hospital after four days; one person is held.
Telangana: The RTI Commission deals with 18,000 pending cases.
India's Earth has not yet found firm ground despite settling for years but lives remain to be found.
Australia vs South Africa: Travis Head and Josh Hazlewood are set to return, while Mitchell Marsh will captain Australia. Full squad announcements have been made.
Free Fire Max Redeem Codes:
* July 30 is the last day to redeem codes.
* Grab free diamonds, skins, and more on these limited-time offers.
Meteor Shower:
* Two meteor showers are peaking tonight for those with binoculars or telescopes.
* Instructions on viewing can be found online.
Artificial Intelligence:
* OpenAI announces a new "study mode" product for students.
* AI models may learn each other's bad behaviors without being aware of it.
* Samsung shares jump after news of $16.5 billion Tesla chips deal.
European Union: Rules are unveiled for powerful A.I. systems, and A.I.-generated images of child sexual abuse have been flooding the internet.
ChatGPT:
* The new study mode feature has been launched by Google.
* Meta's AI recruiting campaign is on the lookout for a new target.
* The company will let job candidates use artificial intelligence to complete tasks.
Google launches a new AI search feature in the UK, but raises questions about advertisers' use of the tool.
